I

habit
Jason, make everyone else draw out. That's how my Kruphix build works.

How do you like to win?
I dunno, my build seems pretty skill intensive.
Whether I'm decking myself with Blue Sun's Zenith or decking them with Prosperity, it's boring
I guess I like the deck to have more than one way to win, for starters
I think in an ideal world, I will attack and murder everyone with their own creatures. That's my preferred method
....Helix Pinnacle?
Ok - I get it...
These are all just ways to spend the infinite mana the decks VERY EASILY generates
Kydele and Thraisos fuel each other
You tap for a ton of mana and use it to draw cards which gives you more mana
Paradox Engine came along and made the deck insane before anyone even really got to build it
How about group hug with theft options
Let them ramp out their threats for cheap or free and then steal them.
Just keep ways of getting rid of Homeward Path....
Throw in a side of disruption for the inevitable combo player.
Jason: how about a bribery recursion deck? Just get as many copy spell effects and just steal your way to the win. That actually sounds like a lot of fun
I’ve seen a lot of Mizzix decks like that
So Jason, how about turning everyone’s lands into critters and then Insurrection to kill them with their lands.
Because Kydele and Thraisos is Simic?
No - I was looking at other options outside of those two.
Your solution for fixing the deck is to build a different deck?
I mean, that will work
If you’re bored…go for what you like :wink:
Unless you’re hellbent on making them work.
They work, they work very well, but that's the problem
I meant work in a way that’s interesting to you.
I would have to force the deck to do something it's not as good at
Unless I use my infinite mana to Memnarch everything
I thought it would be fun to use my infinite mana to Capsize everything, and it is
How about, turn everyone’s lands into critters and then Clone Legion?
Or Evacuation
Well..that way you get everyone’s lands and can kill them with that huge army...
Verdant Touch has buyback and that's good with Paradox Engine
Buyback is good with Paradox Engine :wink:
That's why I run capsize and Sprout Swarm
I was thinking something more like Nature’s Revolt or Living Plane

Quick question, if I may, on how EDHREC works on the Commander Page? Not sure how to word this question, but here goes. How are the initial recommendations determined for a commander page? Is there a maximum amount of cards to be displayed? Do recommendations only show up for cards over a certain percentage?

For example, Verdurous Gearhulk does not show up on the Atraxa page. However, if I look up V-Hulk individually, I can see it has been included in 109 Atraxa decks.

My guess/assumption is that they are percentage based. My only reason for asking is pure curiosity. Sometimes I like to report stats in articles and there would definitely be a difference between a card I cannot find on the page being in 0 decks or being in 109 decks.

Thanx in advance for the help!
I don't think the recommendations go below ~12%. 109/1761 Atraxa decks is ~6% so it's too low to show up.
Thanks Joey, that is what I was thinking.  I was just curious where the threshold was. It is a great system, I dig it.
wallyd2: there is a maximum number of cards displayed on each page
if we wanted we could display stats for every single card in relation to every other card
but right now there are just some arbitrary cutoffs
I think our ideal version of the website only shows a certain number of cards but then has a "more..." link that populates more cards into the webpage
but the codebase has a long way to go before that's realistic
Honestly, I think it is perfect right where it's at. IMO, having too many recommendations would be overwhelming.
My main reason for asking was for personal knowledge. I want to be fairly accurate if I am spitting out stats in an article, so this helps tremendously. Thanx!
And I reveal Breya and my friends decide it is flavor match for the first one
